detaileddescription.para: The array of all the template actors
The component that handles all the static mesh instances
The actor owning the above visualization component
The time to wait before retrying a to spawn actor that failed
The distance a failed spawned actor needs to move before we retry
Keeping track of all the mass agent this subsystem is responsible for spawning actors

Get the index of the static mesh visual type, will add a new one if does not exist
Desc
is the information for the static mesh that will be instantiated later via AddStaticMeshInstance()
The index of the static mesh type

Creates a dedicated visual type described by host Desc and ties ISMComponent to it.
this is a helper function for a common "single ISMComponent" case. Calls AddVisualDescWithISMComponents under the hood.
The index of the visual type

Creates a dedicated visual type described by host Desc and ties given ISMComponents to it.
The index of the visual type
Fetches FMassISMCSharedData indicated by DescriptionIndex, or nullptr if it's not a valid index
Fetches FMassISMCSharedData indicated by an ISMC, or nullptr if the ISMC is not represented by any shared data.

Removes the visualization data associated with the given ISM component. Note that this is safe to do only when there are no entities relying on this data. No entity data patching will take place. Note that the function will assert if there's more ISM components associated with given visualization. Also, in that case RemoveVisualDescByIndex will be called under the hood.
Removes all data associated with a given VisualizationIndex. Note that this is safe to do only if there are no entities relying on this index. No entity data patching will take place.

simplesect.para: the array of all the static mesh instance component information

detaileddescription.para: Mark render state of the static mesh instances dirty

Store the template actor uniquely and return an index to it
ActorClass
is a template actor class we will need to spawn for an agent
The index of the template actor type

memberdef.argsstring: (const FMassEntityHandle MassAgent, const FTransform &Transform, const int16 TemplateActorIndex, FMassActorSpawnRequestHandle &InOutSpawnRequestHandle, float Priority=MAX_FLT, FMassActorPreSpawnDelegate ActorPreSpawnDelegate=FMassActorPreSpawnDelegate(), FMassActorPostSpawnDelegate ActorPostSpawnDelegate=FMassActorPostSpawnDelegate())
memberdef.name: GetOrSpawnActorFromTemplate

detaileddescription.para:
Get or spawn an actor from the TemplateActorIndex
MassAgent
is the handle to the associated mass agent
Transform
where to create this actor
TemplateActorIndex
is the index of the type fetched with FindOrAddTemplateActor()
SpawnRequestHandle
[IN/OUT] IN: previously requested spawn OUT: newly requested spawn
Priority
of this spawn request in comparison with the others, lower value means higher priority (optional)
ActorPreSpawnDelegate
is an optional delegate called before the spawning of an actor
ActorPostSpawnDelegate
is an optional delegate called once the actor is spawned
The spawned actor from the template actor type if ready

memberdef.argsstring: (const FMassEntityHandle MassAgent, const int16 TemplateActorIndex, FMassActorSpawnRequestHandle &SpawnRequestHandle)
memberdef.name: CancelSpawning

detaileddescription.para:
Cancel spawning request that is matching the TemplateActorIndex
MassAgent
is the handle to the associated mass agent
TemplateActorIndex
is the template type of the actor to release in case it was successfully spawned
SpawnRequestHandle
[IN/OUT] previously requested spawn, gets invalidated as a result of this call.
True if spawning request was canceled

memberdef.argsstring: (const FMassEntityHandle MassAgent, const int16 TemplateActorIndex, AActor *ActorToRelease, bool bImmediate)
memberdef.name: ReleaseTemplateActor

detaileddescription.para:
Release an actor that is matching the TemplateActorIndex
MassAgent
is the handle to the associated mass agent
TemplateActorIndex
is the template type of the actor to release in case it was successfully spawned
ActorToRelease
is the actual actor to release if any
bImmediate
means it needs to be done immediately and not queue for later
True if actor was released

memberdef.argsstring: (const FMassEntityHandle MassAgent, const int16 TemplateActorIndex, AActor *ActorToRelease, FMassActorSpawnRequestHandle &SpawnRequestHandle)
memberdef.name: ReleaseTemplateActorOrCancelSpawning

detaileddescription.para:
Release an actor or cancel its spawning if it is matching the TemplateActorIndex
MassAgent
is the handle to the associated mass agent
TemplateActorIndex
is the template type of the actor to release in case it was successfully spawned
ActorToRelease
is the actual actor to release if any
SpawnRequestHandle
[IN/OUT] previously requested spawn, gets invalidated as a result of this call.
True if actor was released or spawning request was canceled

Compare if an actor matches the registered template actor
Actor
to compare its class against the template
TemplateActorIndex
is the template type of the actor to compare against
True if actor matches the template
Responds to the FMassEntityTemplate getting destroyed, and releases reference to corresponding Actor in TemplateActors
Release all references to static meshes and template actors Use with caution, all entities using this representation subsystem must be destroy otherwise they will point to invalid resources

memberdef.argsstring: (const float DeltaSeconds, const EMassProcessingPhase Phase) const
memberdef.name: OnProcessingPhaseStarted

detaileddescription.para: Needed for batching the update of static mesh transform
Subsystem responsible for all visual of mass agents, will handle actors spawning and static mesh instances
